metadata.feature_description: Provides integration point for Evoq Assistant chat feature within PersonaBar.

test_scenarios.scenario_name: Verify Assistant UI Presence in PersonaBar

steps.action: Logged into DNN as SuperUser (host) and accessed PersonaBar
steps.expected: PersonaBar should display an Assistant menu item or chat icon
steps.actual: PersonaBar displayed Dashboard, Content, Manage, Page Analytics, Settings, and Accounts icons. No Assistant icon or menu item was visible.

steps.action: Expanded Settings menu to search for Assistant submenu
steps.expected: Settings menu might contain an Assistant configuration option
steps.actual: Settings menu showed: Site Settings, Security, Workflow, SEO, Community, Gamification, Vocabularies, Connectors, Extensions, Services, Servers, Import/Export, Scheduler, Custom CSS, SQL Console, Config Manager, Prompt, About. No Assistant option present.

steps.action: Navigated to Extensions page to verify if Evoq.Assistant module is installed
steps.expected: Evoq.Assistant or Assistant module should be listed in installed extensions
steps.actual: Reviewed full list of 40+ installed modules. No 'Evoq Assistant' or 'Assistant' module was found in the Extensions list. The module required for this integration is not installed.

issues: The Evoq.Assistant module is not installed on this site
Without the Evoq.Assistant module, the integration point in PersonaBar.UI cannot function
No UI element exists to test the Assistant chat feature

observations: Code analysis reveals EvoqPersonaBarContainer.cs (lines 140-145) contains integration logic for 'Evoq.Assistant' that loads '../Modules/Evoq.Assistant/Scripts/AssistantChat' when the menu item exists and user has VIEW permission
The integration is conditional on LicenseHelper.HasLicense() returning true (line 129), which should be satisfied as the site shows 'trial version of Evoq Engage'
The Evoq.Assistant module is referenced in RootItems (line 45) as a PersonaBar root menu item
The actual Evoq.Assistant module files are NOT present in the Dnn.AdminExperience.Evoq.Basic repository - it appears to be a separate module/extension
Since the Evoq.Assistant module is not installed, no UI element appears and the feature cannot be tested via UI interaction
This is an integration point only - the actual Evoq Assistant functionality requires the separate Evoq.Assistant module to be installed
